item.title: 160: What if you were assaulted by a stranger in the dark?
item.description:
“Right in the center of your body there’s this lead heavy ball, and inside of it is an immediate understanding of evil.”


Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A woman walking to work in the early morning hours faces the ultimate terror.


Today’s episode features Kira Knight. You can reach Kira at violentcrimesurvivors@gmail.com

item.title: 159: What if someone you love committed a monstrous crime?
item.description:
“I could live with the nightmares. I could live with the panic attacks. But the thing that was tearing me apart was questioning if everything I know in my life was real at all.”


Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A lifelong friendship filled with care, love and personal growth takes a shocking turn in the aftermath of a brutal act of violence.


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening

Shop at the Store: The This Is Actually Happening online store is now officially open. Follow this link: www.actuallyhappeningstore.com to access branded t-shirts, posters, stickers and more from the shop. 


Content/Trigger Warnings: childhood trauma, parental abuse, graphic violence, murder, explicit language

Outro Music: "The Moon is Down" - El Diablo & Adam Schraft (Rojo y Negro) @eldiablosf @rojo-y-negro www.eldiablobass.com/

item.title: 158: What if you entered The Void?
item.description:
“You try to take off your skin to try to get rid of this voice, and it goes all the way down to the bone.”


Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A man suffering the deep generational traumas of poverty, racism, abuse and mental illness finds transformative power in an ancient plant medicine.


Today’s episode featured Dexter L. Booth. Dexter is the author of the poetry collection, Scratching

the Ghost from Graywolf Press, which won the 2012 Cave Canem Poetry Prize, as well as the chapbook Rhapsody from Etchings Press. Booth’s poems have been included in the anthologies The Best American Poetry 2015, The Burden of Light: Poems on Illness and Loss, The Golden Shovel Anthology honoring Gwendolyn Brooks, and Furious Flower: Seeding the Future of African American Poetry. He is a professor in the Ashland University MFA program and a residential faculty member at Paradise Valley Community College where he teaches poetry and English composition. You can find out more about Dexter, his writing and teaching by following him on Instagram@dexter_two_omelettes, or on Facebook or Twitter. You can find his books Scratching the Ghost and Rhapsody on Bookshop.org, Amazon, or wherever books are sold.


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening


Engage with the Community: Join the This Is Actually Happening Discussion Group on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/201783687561039/


Shop at the Store: The This Is Actually Happening online store is now officially open. Follow this link: www.actuallyhappeningstore.com to access branded t-shirts, posters, stickers and more from the shop. 


Content/Trigger Warnings: domestic abuse, mental illness, suicide, explicit language


Intro Music: "Illabye" – Tipper

Music Bed: “Union Flow” - Spuntic

Outro Music: "The Moon is Down" - El Diablo & Adam Schraft (Rojo y Negro) @eldiablosf @rojo-y-negro www.eldiablobass.com/

 

Services

If you or someone you know is struggling with the effects of trauma or mental illness, please refer to the following resources:


National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-8255 

National Alliance on Mental Illness: 1-800-950-6264

Crisis Text Line: Within the US, text HOME to 741741

item.title: Rebroadcast - #43: What if you witnessed a thousand deaths?
item.description:
"All of the ways we define ourselves are going to be stripped away by illness or the dying process...now who am I?"


Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: After 30 years running a Zen Hospice center, a man reflects on what it's like to help transition people through the dying process.


Today’s episode features Frank Ostaseski

Author of: "The Five Invitations: What death can teach us about living fully”

Website: https://fiveinvitations.com/about-frank-ostaseski/

item.title: Rebroadcast - #93: What if you witnessed the limits of human suffering?
item.description:
**This rebroadcast episode originally aired in April, 2017**

“It’s in these places that you begin to see the limits of human capacity – how resilient we are...how we will find a way.”


Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A Yale student moves to Congo to pursue his journalistic dreams and finds an ignored world of people suffering under war and dictatorship whose stories never make the news

A wide-eyed Yale graduate shares stories of Congo, where he dedicated himself to exposing what the modern world closed its eyes to.

Today’s episode features Anjan Sundaram, Author of: "Stringer: A Reporter's Journey in the Congo" and "Bad News: Last Journalists in a Dictatorship"

Website: anjansundaram.com, Twitter: @anjansun


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening


Engage with the Community: Join the This Is Actually Happening Discussion Group on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/201783687561039/


Shop at the Store: The This Is Actually Happening online store is now officially open. Follow this link: www.actuallyhappeningstore.com to access branded t-shirts, posters, stickers and more from the shop. 


Content/Trigger Warnings: war, violence, explicit language


Intro Music: "Illabye" – Tipper

Music Bed: Ryan Black - ryanblack.io

Outro Music: "The Moon is Down" - El Diablo & Adam Schraft (Rojo y Negro) @eldiablosf @rojo-y-negro www.eldiablobass.com/

 

Services

If you or someone you know is struggling with the effects of trauma or mental illness, please refer to the following resources:


National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-8255 

National Alliance on Mental Illness: 1-800-950-6264

National Sexual Assault Hotline (RAINN): 1-800-656-HOPE (4673)

Crisis Text Line: Within the US, text HOME to 741741

**This rebroadcast episode originally aired in April, 2017**

“It’s in these places that you begin to see the limits of human capacity – how resilient we are...how we will find a way.”


Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A Yale student moves to Congo to pursue his journalistic dreams and finds an ignored world of people suffering under war and dictatorship whose stories never make the news

A wide-eyed Yale graduate shares stories of Congo, where he dedicated himself to exposing what the modern world closed its eyes to.

Today’s episode features Anjan Sundaram, Author of: "Stringer: A Reporter's Journey in the Congo" and "Bad News: Last Journalists in a Dictatorship"

Website: anjansundaram.com, Twitter: @anjansun


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com

item.title: 157: What if you couldn't tell anyone?
item.description:
“The idea that they had plucked me from this terrible life…and it was all going to be sunflowers and rainbows and shit…I just view that as a fantasy.”


Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A young black girl born to a drug-addicted mother is adopted by white, middle-class parents, only to face more sinister taboos as she becomes a stranger within her own family.

item.title: 156: What if you swallowed 48 bags of cocaine?
item.description:

item.title: 155: What if you had to pull the plug?
item.description:
“When somebody hurts you and then they’re like, ‘now you have to take care of him, you’re responsible for him…’ I didn’t know how to feel.”


Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A young woman is forced to make a decision about the fate of a father she never knew.

item.title: 154: What if your mom was murdered by a serial killer?
item.description:
“I had total grief and sadness and fear and also just disbelief that it happened. But it’s different when you lose somebody who hurt you.”


Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: After surviving a family broken by drug addiction and mental illness, a woman finds out her mother’s death was tied to one of the most notorious crimes in American history.


Today’s episode featured Nova Reeves. To find out more about Nova, you can Google her article on the death penalty in the Tacoma Tribune. You can hear her reading poetry on YouTube by searching for Quiet Lightning. You can also get a copy of her zine by emailing her directly at novareeves@gmail.com


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com

item.title: BONUS Episode - Tyson Was Abducted - from What Was That Like podcast
item.description:
Today, I'm introducing the podcast What Was That Like, by Scott Johnson. Featuring real people in unreal situations, What Was That Like covers similar, jaw-dropping stories to This Is Actually Happening, but with its own uniquely fascinating format and style.

Today's show will feature a full episode from What Was That Like titled, "Tyson was abducted," about a man who, walking through a parking lot one night, was jumped by two strangers and thrown into a car with no idea where he was being taken. 

You can find the rest of What Was That Like, by Scott Johnson, on all podcast platforms, or check out the website, at whatwasthatlike.com

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: 153: What if you wanted to disappear?
item.description:
“I had this secret inside me that I felt was my one and only friend and companion that took me away from all the pain and anxiety that I had moving through my life.”


Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A young girl’s world is turned upside-down by the early death of her father, but starving herself to cope with the pain becomes a sinister companion

item.title: 152: What if you were a human shield?
item.description:
“This fake face I was putting on for everybody was my only sense of normality when my whole life is already changed. I didn’t want to admit that stuff was wrong, and I did it in such a convincing way that the majority of people believed me.”


Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A man becomes a hero during a horrific act of war only to face the worst of it after he survives.


Today's episode featured Will Hoover. To find out more about Will, he’s on Twitter and Instagram @WillHooverTV, or you can check his own recently launched podcast about film and technology called Uncovered Cinema.


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening


Engage with the Community: Join the This Is Actually Happening Discussion Group on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/201783687561039/


Shop at the Store: The This Is Actually Happening online store is now officially open. Follow this link: www.actuallyhappeningstore.com to access branded t-shirts, posters, stickers and more from the shop. 


Content/Trigger Warnings: war, severe injury, gun violence, PTSD, explicit language

Music Bed: Ambient themes by Nigel Coutinho

Outro Music: "The Moon is Down" - El Diablo & Adam Schraft (Rojo y Negro) @eldiablosf @rojo-y-negro www.eldiablobass.com/

item.title: 151: What if he made you think you were crazy?
item.description:
“I was sure that this was his mental illness and not something wrong with me until I started hearing it in my head. And that was when I started to think, 'maybe I’m actually going crazy'.”


Producers: Sara Marinelli, Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A woman finds respite from childhood anxieties in relationships only to enter a spiral of mental illness and unexplained phenomena. 


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com

item.itunes:summary: A woman finds respite from childhood anxieties in relationships only to enter a spiral of mental illness and unexplained phenomena.
item.content:encoded:
“I was sure that this was his mental illness and not something wrong with me until I started hearing it in my head. And that was when I started to think, 'maybe I’m actually going crazy'.”


Producers: Sara Marinelli, Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A woman finds respite from childhood anxieties in relationships only to enter a spiral of mental illness and unexplained phenomena. 


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening


Engage with the Community: Join the This Is Actually Happening Discussion Group on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/201783687561039/


Shop at the Store: The This Is Actually Happening online store is now officially open. Follow this link: www.actuallyhappeningstore.com to access branded t-shirts, posters, stickers and more from the shop. 


Content/Trigger Warnings: emotional abuse, sexual abuse, domestic violence, drug use, explicit language


Intro Music: ""Illabye" – Tipper

Music Bed: “Cylinder Four/Cylinder Five” – Chris Zabriskie

Outro Music: "The Moon is Down" - El Diablo & Adam Schraft (Rojo y Negro) @eldiablosf @rojo-y-negro www.eldiablobass.com/

 

Services

If you or someone you know is struggling with the effects of trauma or mental illness, please refer to the following resources:


National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-8255 

National Alliance on Mental Illness: 1-800-950-6264

National Sexual Assault Hotline (RAINN): 1-800-656-HOPE (4673)

Crisis Text Line: Within the US, text HOME to 741741

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: 150: What if you were trapped in a cycle of abuse?
item.description:
“My earliest memories as a child were fear and anxiety…I was never able to control the situation and that unknown just haunted me.”


Producer/Editor: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A girl straddles many worlds growing up biracial with a single white mother whose new boyfriend brings chaos into a peaceful home.


Today’s episode featured Arielle Hermanson. You can find her on Twitter and Instagram @arijblige


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening

Shop at the Store: The This Is Actually Happening online store is now officially open. Follow this link: www.actuallyhappeningstore.com to access branded t-shirts, posters, stickers and more from the shop. 


Content/Trigger Warnings: abuse, domestic violence, explicit language

Music Bed: “Union Flow” - Spuntic

Outro Music: "The Moon is Down" - El Diablo & Adam Schraft (Rojo y Negro) @eldiablosf @rojo-y-negro www.eldiablobass.com/

 

Services

If you or someone you know is struggling with the effects of trauma or mental illness, please refer to the following resources:


National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-8255 

National Alliance on Mental Illness: 1-800-950-6264

National Sexual Assault Hotline (RAINN): 1-800-656-HOPE (4673)

Crisis Text Line: Within the US, text HOME to 741741

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: 149: What if you committed child sexual abuse?
item.description:
“I misused my position of power to get my needs met…How is it that if we’re called by God to this ministry we could possibly do such a destructive thing?”


Producers/Editors: Nigel Coutinho, Stephanie Lepp, Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A priest struggles to transform his life after facing the consequences of his most shameful secret. 


Today's episode featured Gil Gustafson. This episode was originally produced by Stephanie Lepp at Reckonings, and adapted for This Is Actually Happening. You can find Reckonings wherever you listen, and at: www.reckonings.show


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening

Shop at the Store: The This Is Actually Happening online store is now officially open. Follow this link: www.actuallyhappeningstore.com to access branded t-shirts, posters, stickers and more from the shop. 


Content/Trigger Warnings: child sexual abuse, explicit language

Music Bed: Ambient Themes by Nigel Coutinho

Outro Music: "The Moon is Down" - El Diablo & Adam Schraft (Rojo y Negro) @eldiablosf @rojo-y-negro www.eldiablobass.com/

item.title: 148: What if you killed someone?
item.description:
“We have so much less control than we think we do….Death is really close at hand and we do not do ourselves often any favors by forgetting that.”


Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: Firmly established in adulthood with a great career behind her and a wonderful life, a woman suddenly finds herself to be an unlikely perpetrator of the most horrible transgression. 


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening

Shop at the Store: The This Is Actually Happening online store is now officially open. Follow this link: www.actuallyhappeningstore.com to access branded t-shirts, posters, stickers and more from the shop. 


Content/Trigger Warnings: death, car crash, explicit language

Outro Music: "The Moon is Down" - El Diablo & Adam Schraft (Rojo y Negro) @eldiablosf @rojo-y-negro www.eldiablobass.com/

item.title: 147: What if your best friend was dying?
item.description:
“It’s much better to try to move forward with your life and accept that things are nebulous, and there are no clear answers.”


Producer: Whit Missildine

Editors: Sara Marinelli, Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: After finally being accepted to an elite college sorority, a woman makes a new best friend whose terminal illness leaves her consumed by uncertainty. 


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening

Content/Trigger Warnings: explicit language

item.title: 146: What if you thought your mother was a robot?
item.description:
“I completely lost touch with reality. You can’t rely on those around you, and you can’t rely on what’s within you. That’s the most terrifying thing in the world.”


Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: Struggling to find his identity after college, a man suddenly suffers from panic attack that leads to a terrifying downward spiral. 


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening

Shop at the Store: The This Is Actually Happening online store is now officially open. Follow this link: www.actuallyhappeningstore.com to access branded t-shirts, posters, stickers and more from the shop. 


Content/Trigger Warnings: drug use, mental breakdown, explicit language

item.title: Best of TIAH #1 – Rebroadcast - #120 What if you had Dissociative Identity Disorder?
item.description:
“I don’t really remember not having different parts…I just thought that everybody had different quote unquote people inside them.”


Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A woman suffers immeasurable trauma at the hands of her abusive parents as traffickers, resulting in a number of “alters” that inhabit her.


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening

Shop at the Store: The This Is Actually Happening online store is now officially open. Follow this link: www.actuallyhappeningstore.com to access branded t-shirts, posters, stickers and more from the shop. 


Content/Trigger Warnings: parental abuse, torture, sexual abuse, sex trafficking, murder, severe mental illness

Music Bed: “Water” – Johannes Welsch

Outro Music: "The Moon is Down" - El Diablo & Adam Schraft (Rojo y Negro) @eldiablosf @rojo-y-negro www.eldiablobass.com/

item.title: Best of TIAH #3 – Rebroadcast – #112: What if a murderer appeared at your bedroom door?
item.description:
"What happened to me is one of those things where people say, like, 'that could never happen to you.' So now once that happened, it's like well anything can happen to me at any time."

 

Producer: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: Megan’s close relationship with her mother turns into a shocking, unthinkable nightmare when an unlikely intruder enters their home. 


A violent and unexpected home invasion claims the life of a young woman's mother


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

item.title: 145: What if your best friend met a tragic fate?
item.description:
“I’m the kind of person where I like to know answers. I don’t like secrets I don’t like surprises…I really want to know what brought him to that. I really want to know why.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editors: Nigel Coutinho, Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: After his best friend contracts a rare disease, a man’s friendship deepens as they grow into adulthood together, only to end with a sudden, shocking turn of events.

item.title: 144: What if you suffered from postpartum depression?
item.description:
“All those thoughts were going through my head like you’re worthless, you’re a loser, you’re a failure, you can’t be happy, you can’t feel love…just this feeling of profound failure.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editors: Sara Marinelli, Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A woman sinks into a psychological black hole following what was supposed to be the greatest moment of her life.

item.title: 143: What if you were seduced into a whole new world?
item.description:
“Am I at fault? Am I not a victim? Should I not be able to say that because I let it happen? I don’t know if in the human heart there will ever be black and white answers to something like that.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editor: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: Leaving her sheltered but complicated evangelical Christian past, a woman explores a kinky relationship that leads her to some of the darkest corners of the world.


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening

item.title: 142: What if it happened in broad daylight?
item.description:
“I didn’t really realize that it was a thing that was happening to me. I don’t really know how to describe that feeling, but it was just so hard to understand.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editors: Nigel Coutinho, Whit Missildine

item.title: 141: What if you witnessed a horrific act?
item.description:
“I just felt something inside of me that was so sickening. It’s just like this point of realization, almost like your biggest fear in that moment had come true.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editor: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: Growing up in a small Midwest town, a teenage girl forms a close friendship with a boy from a nearby town, when things unexpectedly take a very dark turn.

item.title: 140: What if you were entangled in a web of shame?
item.description:
“It’s just confusing thinking about even today what I’m supposed to feel about the whole thing…humans aren’t really built to fully understand that kind of relationship.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editor: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: Struggling with depression and gender dysphoria, a person finds solace in an online community, but relationships become shockingly complicated by the disruptive actions of one notorious member.

item.title: 139: What if your father disappeared?
item.description:
“The worst thing that anxiety does is make you think that you have control to change something, like if I can constantly be in control of everything then nothing bad will happen.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editors: Nigel Coutinho, Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A family who for years struggled to cope with the aftermath of a traumatic injury now faces a far more terrifying unknown: the disappearance of their father.

item.title: 138: What if at three months pregnant your world was turned upside down?
item.description:
“It’s like this weird tunnel of reality collapsing and you want to hold on to where you just were at where none of this happened, but now you have this thing that you have to absorb somehow.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editors: Nigel Coutinho, Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: A woman is three months pregnant when her husband’s pursuit of a fugitive turns their world upside down.


Today's episode features Shideh Etaat. If you'd like to donate to the GoFundMe page for her husband's recovery, follow the link below. http://bit.ly/shidehgofundme

item.title: 137: What if you were the one to break the silence?
item.description:
“I don’t know what I was thinking but I just kept feeling like the waves of shame because of the shame I made them feel.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editor: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: Growing up in a household full of both love and violence in Mississippi, Kiese Laymon struggles with generational trauma, career success, and addiction before finally facing the silences of his past.


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening


Engage with the Community: Join the This Is Actually Happening Discussion Group on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/201783687561039/


Shop at the Store: The This Is Actually Happening online store is now officially open. Follow this link: www.actuallyhappeningstore.com to access branded t-shirts, posters, stickers and more from the shop. 


Content/Trigger Warnings: physical violence, assault, emotional abuse, explicit language


Intro Music: ""Illabye" – Tipper

Music Bed: “Re-entry” – Lee Rosevere

Outro Music: "The Moon is Down" - El Diablo & Adam Schraft (Rojo y Negro) @eldiablosf @rojo-y-negro www.eldiablobass.com/

 

Services

If you or someone you know is struggling with the effects of trauma or mental illness, please refer to the following resources:


National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-8255 

National Alliance on Mental Illness: 1-800-950-6264

National Sexual Assault Hotline (RAINN): 1-800-656-HOPE (4673)

item.title: 136: What if you had to fight for your life?
item.description:
“I did have the feeling that someone was gonna come back and do something horrible again after that.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editors: Nigel Coutinho, Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: Terra Newell is thrown a nightmare scenario as her mother’s new love life spins out of control, while the ordeal takes on a new life as the centerpiece of the famous Dirty John podcast and TV series.

item.title: 135: What if a minor procedure left you permanently altered?
item.description:
“My personhood had been shattered into a thousand pieces that I and my family were left to pick up one at a time.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editor: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: After self-medicating for years to cope with the emotional aftermath of an abusive, religious upbringing, a woman goes in for a minor surgery, and when she emerges, everything has changed.


Today's episode features Olivia Wilder. You can find out more about Olivia in Instagram @oliviaamputeefitness


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com

item.title: 134: What if your singular dream fell to pieces?
item.description:
“How could I allow myself to mourn what I had lost? Because if I mourned it, then it was like a death, and I couldn’t accept that the me that I knew had died.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editor: Whit Missildine


Episode Summary: After devoting his life to a singular passion, a man develops a rare condition that threatens to crush his dreams forever.


Today’s episode featured Stefan Weiner. As a musician, he goes by Stefan Alexander and you can hear more about his music on his website at www.stefanalxndr.com, on Instagram @stefanalxndr, or look for Stefan Alexander on any music platform.


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening


Engage with the Community: Join the This Is Actually Happening Discussion Group on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/201783687561039/


Shop at the Store: The This Is Actually Happening online store is now officially open. Follow this link: www.actuallyhappeningstore.com to access branded t-shirts, posters, stickers and more from the shop. 


Content/Trigger Warnings: explicit language


Intro Music: ""Illabye" – Tipper

Music Bed: “Cylinder Four” “Cylinder Five” – Chris Zabriskie

Outro Music: "The Moon is Down" - El Diablo & Adam Schraft (Rojo y Negro) @eldiablosf @rojo-y-negro www.eldiablobass.com/

 

Services

If you or someone you know is struggling with the effects of trauma or mental illness, please refer to the following resources:


National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-8255 

National Alliance on Mental Illness: 1-800-950-6264

National Sexual Assault Hotline (RAINN): 1-800-656-HOPE (4673)

Crisis Text Line: Within the US, text HOME to 741741

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: 133: What if your life went up in flames?
item.description:
“All that traumatized people are really looking for is not a fix-it but more like a validation or acknowledgement that it matters.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editor: Nigel Coutinho


Episode Summary: A woman finally establishes a life for herself after years of caring for her mother’s illness, only to watch her entire life be consumed before her eyes.

item.title: 132: What if you were kept from the one you loved most?
item.description:
“It’s interesting always having this void, knowing that you have something so wonderful that could love you so much and you could love so much that exists out there.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editor: Nigel Coutinho


Episode Summary: A young man falls deeply in love after meeting the girl of his dreams, leading to an unexpected event that leaves him with an irreparable void.

Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com

item.title: 131: What if a psychotic break split your life wide open?
item.description:
“I have a fear every single day am I going crazy and I don’t even know it? I didn’t know the things that I was doing and the things that I was saying were so extreme.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editor: Nigel Coutinho


Episode Summary: After surviving a father whose mental illness consumed the family, a woman spirals down into psychosis and compulsive behaviors, finally leading her on the path to healing.


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening

item.title: 130: What if you had thoughts of harming those you love most?
item.description:
“People say you should always trust your gut feelings. But I couldn’t trust my gut feeling and I still can’t to this day, because to me a gut feeling is in turn thinking about hurting somebody else.”

 

Producer: Whit Missildine

Editor: Nigel Coutinho


Episode Summary: After coming to terms with her identity, a woman develops intrusive thoughts that consume her most important relationships.  


Social Media: Instagram: @actuallyhappening

Website: www.thisisactuallyhappening.com


Support the Show: Support The Show on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/happening
